Name: Fungal infection
Under_13: Fluconazole (50 mg), Ketoconazole (100 mg) and Terbinafine (125 mg)

Name: Allergy
Under_13: Loratadine (5 mg), Cetirizine (Syrup) and Diphenhydramine (Syrup)

Name: Drug Reaction
Under_13: Diphenhydramine (Syrup), Prednisone (Syrup) and Epinephrine (1 mg/kg)

Name: AIDS
Under_13: Tenofovir, Emtricitabine and Lopinavir/ritonavir

Name: Diabetes
Under_13: Insulin dose and Glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) receptor agonists

Name: Gastroenteritis
Under_13: Loperamide (Syrup), Doxycycline (100 mg) and Metronidazole (Syrup)

Name: Bronchial Asthma
Under_13: Albuterol (90 mcg), Fluticasone (Cream) and Montelukast (5 mg)

Name: Migraine
Under_13: ondansetron (4 mg), Ibuprofen (Syrup) and  cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT)

Name: Cervical spondylosis
Under_13: Acetaminophen (Syrup), Ibuprofen (Syrup) and Naproxen (5-10 mg)

Name: Jaundice
Under_13: Ursodeoxycholic acid (150 mg), S-adenosylmethionine (SAMe) and Milk thistle

Name: Malaria
Under_13: Chloroquine (Syrup), Artemether-lumefantrine and Doxycycline (100mg)

Name: Chicken pox
Under_13: Acyclovir (200 mg), Valacyclovir (1 g) and Famciclovir (1 g)

Name: Dengue
Under_13: Paracetamol (Syrup), Oral rehydration solution and Platelet transfusion
Above_13: Paracetamol, Oral rehydration solution, Platelet transfusion

Name: Typhoid
Under_13: Ciprofloxacin (250 mg), Ceftriaxone (500 mg) and Azithromycin (250 mg)

Name: hepatitis A

Above_13: Hepatitis A vaccine, Immune globulin, Fosamprenavir

Name: Hepatitis B
Under_13: Hepatitis B vaccine, Entecavir (as prescribed) and Tenofovir (as prescribed)

Name: Hepatitis C
Under_13: Hepatitis C vaccine (as prescribed), Sofosbuvir (as prescribed) and Daclatasvir (as prescribed)

Name: Hepatitis D
Under_13: Interferon alfa (as prescribed ), Lamivudine (as prescribed) and Adefovir (as prescribed)

Name: Hepatitis E
Under_13: Ribavirin (as prescribed), Peginterferon alfa (as prescribed) and Sofosbuvir (as prescribed)

Name: Alcoholic hepatitis
Under_13: Corticosteroids (Cream), Pentoxifylline and Naltrexone

Name: Tuberculosis
Under_13: Isoniazid (10 mg/kg), Rifampin (500 mg) and Ethambutol (400 mg)

Name: Common Cold
Under_13: Acetaminophen (Syrup), Ibuprofen (Syrup) and pseudoephedrine (100 mg)

Name: Pneumonia
Under_13: Azithromycin (250 mg), Levofloxacin (250 mg) and Ceftriaxone (500 mg)

Name: Dimorphic hemmorhoids(piles)
Under_13: Hydrocortisone (Syrup), Witch hazel and Lidocaine (as prescribed)

Name: Varicose veins
Above_13: Compression stockings, Sclerotherapy, Endovenous laser treatment

Name: Hypoglycemia
Under_13: Glucose tablets, Glucagon (1 mg) and Diazoxide (10 mg)

Name: (vertigo) Paroymsal  Positional Vertigo
Under_13: Meclizine, Diazepam (Syrup) and Epley maneuver

Name: Acne

Above_13: Benzoyl peroxide, Salicylic acid, Topical retinoids

Name: Urinary tract infection
Under_13: Trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole (Syrup), Nitrofurantoin (50mg) and Ciprofloxacin (250 mg)

Name: Impetigo
